text: hello everyone my name is Marwan basuni
and I'm a Solutions architect at AWS
specializing in Amazon connect
Amazon connect is an easy to use
omni-channel cloud-based contact center
in this video I will be focusing on
enabling message receipts for chat user
interface so customers know the status
of the messages they send
this provides transparency to both
customers and agents and help to improve
the overall chat experience let's get
started
Amazon connect lets you build chatting
features into your website
it enables your customers to start
chatting with contact center Agents from
any of your business applications web or
mobile
interactions are asynchronous enabling
your customers to start a chat with an
agent or Amazon like spot step away from
it and then resume the conversation
again
they can even switch devices and
continue to chat
considering the asynchronous nature of
chat interactions have you ever
contacted your insurance or airline
company and Midway through the
conversation you are frustrated when the
agent did not respond in a timely
fashion have you ever wondered if the
agent saw your message and is going to
respond back to your query
perhaps you've been disconnected
momentarily from the chat session and
when reconnected you did not have
visibility on whether your message has
been successfully delivered
such situations result in a lack of
transparency and can lead to frustration
and eventually abandonment not just from
that single chat session but from the
company
what if there is a way to get
confirmation when your messages are
received and viewed
Amazon connect chat allows agents and
customers to receive message delivered
and read receipts after they send a chat
message
receipts are useful as they provide
confirmation that the message has been
successfully delivered and read by the
recipient
this sample verification that a message
has been delivered and read has a big
impact on making communication between
customers and agents more authentic
it takes customers out of the unknown
state where they have zero indication of
when and if their message has been sent
and seen to a state where there is a
subtle indication of the immediacy in
which they will get a reply
let's explore the requirements of
different contact center personas for
chat message receipts customers and
agents would like the ability to see
when a message they send has been
delivered and read by chat participant
so they are more confident about the
level of Engagement this provides
customers with a sense on when they can
expect to get a response and for agents
it improves the handle time as well as
the experience
for admins it means they can turn on and
off message receipts for both customers
and agents as well as leverage these
receipts to send notification for a
synchronous chat experiences
finally contact center analysts would
have data that provide them with the
information on delivered and read
percentage so they can measure customer
engagement improve agent efficiency and
determine the impact of message receipts
on key performance indicators such as
average handle time net promoter score
engagement and abandon rates
let's dive deep into how you can get
started with chat message receipts
there are two ways chat messages are
received
the first one is establishing and
subscribing to a websocket connection
this is how chat participants like
agents and customers receive chat
messages
in addition customers looking to extend
Amazon connect chat functionality to
build SMS Solutions or integrate with
third-party applications can use the
real-time message streaming apis to
configure endpoints where they want to
receive chat messages
if you would like to enable or disable
chat message receipts for the hosted
chat widget you can do this using the
Amazon connect admin console if you are
a developer building a custom user
interface you can enable or disable
message receipts using a flag in chat Js
check out the resources in the video
description to learn more
chat message receipts are enabled by
default in the test chat experience the

chat conversation

you can configure the chat widget in the

customize the Fontan colors and secure
the widget so that it can be launched
only from your website
as a result you will have a shortcode
snippet that you add to your website
agents use the contact control panel or
CCP to interact with customer contacts
it's how they receive calls chat with
contacts transfer them to other agents
put them on hold and perform other key
tasks
once I click on open chat button a chat
contact is created placed in the queue
and routed to an available agent
the agent will start the conversation by
greeting the customer with a welcome
message hi John how can I help you in
this example the customer would like to
check their account balance
notice if the agent is not scrolled all
the way down in the CCP the message
receipt will show delivered on the
customer side
once the agent Scrolls down to the
latest message the notification will
change to red
the same concept applies when the
customer is scrolled up in the chat
widget and the agent sends a message
please note that a message is marked as
read only if the chat participant window
is in focus and is scrolled down to view
the latest message
finally the agent provides the requested
information in this case it's the
customer's saving account balance and
the chat session ends
the agent can then close the contact
let's take a look at what we have
learned today
with chat message receipts we covered
some of the challenges in asynchronous
chat conversations we looked at the
default settings to enable and disable
message receipts based on the chat user
interface selected and we saw the agent
and customer experience in action some
of the benefits for chat message
receipts include increased transparency
in chat conversations higher engagement
rates and reduce the abandoned rates
since both customers and agents have
full visibility on when and if the
messages have been received and viewed
